author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: One characteristic of modern poetry is that arrangement of parts which strikes many people as being violent or obscure.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: Local images have one kind of reality. 'U.S. 1' will, I hope, have that kind and another, too. Poetry can extend the document.
author: Muriel Rukeyser

quote: The moment of change is the only poem.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: The poet may be used as a barometer, but let us not forget that he is also part of the weather.
author: Lionel Trilling

quote: The romanticised life, where all the great poetry and music and art of the world comes from, is great but it requires a lot of self-indulgence.
author: Laura Marling

quote: Poetry is the mother-tongue of the human race.
author: Johann Georg Hamann

quote: Most poetry in the modern age has retreated to the private sphere, turning its back on the political realm.
author: Terry Eagleton

quote: Poetry is the most subtle of the literary arts, and students grow more ingenious by the year at avoiding it. If they can nip around Milton, duck under Blake and collapse gratefully into the arms of Jane Austen, a lot of them will.
author: Terry Eagleton

quote: I like to borrow forms and quotes and use a lot of allusions, in both poetry and music.
author: Jamila Woods

quote: When I started writing poetry, it was always in very hip-hop influenced spaces: Someone would teach a Nas song side-by-side with a Gwendolyn Brooks poem, and we'd talk about the connections between those things.
author: Jamila Woods

quote: I have a band called M&O. We were working on our first album in 2011 or 2012. We were looking for people to collaborate with, and I met Chance through a Young Chicago Authors poetry slam.
author: Jamila Woods

quote: It was through poetry I learned just to appreciate my own voice and to not think of my voice in terms of what it needs to be able to do, but what it can do.
author: Jamila Woods

quote: My artistic manifesto exists in the world as poetry. So even though most of the things that I've done have been on other people's projects or could be pigeonholed in certain ways, that's not how I perceive myself.
author: Jamila Woods

quote: I really liked 'Blk Girl Art.' It's like a manifesto saying why I create, whether it's poetry or music.
author: Jamila Woods

quote: Everyone thinks they're going to write one book of poems or one novel.
author: Marilyn Hacker

quote: I love reading all kinds of books. I usually have about ten books going at any one time - books about the past, the present, novels, non-fiction, poetry, mythology, religion, etc. Reading is my favorite thing to do.
author: Mary Pope Osborne

quote: The voice is raised, and that is where poetry begins. And even today, in the prolonged aftermath of modernism, in places where 'open form' or free verse is the orthodoxy, you will find a memory of that raising of the voice in the term 'heightened speech.'
author: James Fenton

quote: Prose on certain occasions can bear a great deal of poetry; on the other hand, poetry sinks and swoons under a moderate weight of prose.
author: Walter Savage Landor

quote: Thomas Davis was a great man where poetry is concerned, and a better than Thomas Moore. All over Ireland his poetry is, and he would have done other things but that he died young.
author: Lady Gregory

quote: In my late teenage years, I developed a real passion for it, and wrote a lot of poetry.
author: Danielle Steel

quote: My favourite room in my house is easily the top room, which is a bedroom but also a bathroom, with a big, wooden carved bath, two huge fireplaces and a raised bit in the corner for performances. I've had some really lovely parties and poetry readings up there.
author: Deborah Moggach

quote: Poetry is not only a set of words which are chosen to relate to each other; it is something which goes much further than that to provide a glimpse of our vision of the world.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: For me, poetry is a situation - a state of being, a way of facing life and facing history.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: Poetry is a form of mathematics, a highly rigorous relationship with words.
author: Tahar Ben Jelloun

quote: I'll try anything, but the pig testicles in Taiwan were a little much. Eh, it wasn't half bad. There was this one dish I had there, the translation is, 'The Monk Jumps over the Fence.' It's a fish dish with all these spices. It was beautiful, man - it was poetry. It had a whole story.
author: Steven Adams

quote: Poetry is a call to action, and it also is action.
author: Juan Felipe Herrera

quote: I gave my voice to poetry.
author: Juan Felipe Herrera

quote: The banner of the project is 'Casa de Colores.' Under that banner, I'm going to invite people to do a lot of good things. Perhaps working in groups, working on poetry.
author: Juan Felipe Herrera

quote: My mother was a washerwoman - or a woman that cleaned houses in Texas... in Plano, Texas - who always loved poetry and always loved stories.
author: Juan Felipe Herrera

quote: I've never written poetry. I'm not a poet, but I think the nearest you get is either the short story or the novella, in that you can't waste a word. There is no hiding place: everything's got to be seen to relate, and the prose counts.
author: Susan Hill

quote: Usually a life turned into a poem is misrepresented.
author: Mark Strand

quote: The novel is born of disillusionment; the poem, of despair.
author: Jose Bergamin

quote: I owe my discovery of the Hot Club of Cowtown to Kinky Friedman, leader of the Texas Jewboys. When I saw that Bob Wills and his Texas Playboys were headlining the 2003 Santa Clarita Cowboy Poetry and Music Festival, I thought it my duty to check out the band that had inspired the Texas Jewboys.
author: Clive Sinclair

quote: But the gravest difficulty, and perhaps the most important, in poetry meant solely for recitation, is the difficulty of achieving verbal beauty, or rather of making verbal beauty tell.
author: Lascelles Abercrombie

quote: That is to say, epic poetry has been invented many times and independently; but, as the needs which prompted the invention have been broadly similar, so the invention itself has been.
author: Lascelles Abercrombie

quote: Poetry lies its way to the truth.
author: John Ciardi

quote: I have a deep and ongoing love of Iceland, particular the landscape, and when writing 'Burial Rites,' I was constantly trying to see whether I could distill its extraordinary and ineffable qualities into a kind of poetry.
author: Hannah Kent

quote: Poetry had great powers over me from my childhood, and today the poems live in my memory which I read at the age of 7 or 8 years and which drove me to desperate attempts at imitation.
author: Bayard Taylor

quote: One will never again look at a birch tree, after the Robert Frost poem, in exactly the same way.
author: Paul Muldoon

quote: A poet's autobiography is his poetry. Anything else is just a footnote.
author: Yevgeny Yevtushenko

quote: Poetry is ordinary language raised to the Nth power. Poetry is boned with ideas, nerved and blooded with emotions, all held together by the delicate, tough skin of words.
author: Paul Engle

quote: There's no musical landscape to poetry. It has somewhat of a higher standard than songs, I think.
author: J. D. Souther

quote: No poem is easily grasped; so why should any reader expect fast results?
author: John Barton

quote: Sometimes poetry is inspired by the conversation entered into by reading other poems.
author: John Barton

quote: I think poetry is the only domain where a writer you like can truly be said to influence you, because you read and reread a poem so many times that it simply drills itself into your head.
author: Michel Houellebecq

quote: A poem might be defined as thinking about feelings - about human feelings and frailties.
author: Anne Stevenson

quote: Each word bears its weight, so you have to read my poems quite slowly.
author: Anne Stevenson

quote: I like poems that are little games.
author: Peter Davison

quote: I am a writer, which means I write stories, I write novels, and I would write poetry if I knew how to. I don't want to limit myself.
author: Aleksandar Hemon

quote: There is also poetry written to be shouted in a square in front of an enthusiastic crowd. This occurs especially in countries where authoritarian regimes are in power.
author: Eugenio Montale

quote: That sense of a life in natural objects, which in most poetry is but a rhetorical artifice, was, then, in Wordsworth the assertion of what was for him almost literal fact.
author: Walter Pater

quote: Many attempts have been made by writers on art and poetry to define beauty in the abstract, to express it in the most general terms, to find some universal formula for it.
author: Walter Pater

quote: Children seem naturally drawn to poetry - it's some combination of the rhyme, rhythm, and the words themselves.
author: Jack Prelutsky

quote: We all need ways to express ourselves, and poetry is one of mine.
author: Jack Prelutsky

quote: I'd always loved poetry and I'd always loved writing music and composing music, but I hadn't thought of putting the two together until around that time.
author: Bruce Cockburn

quote: There'll always be working people in my poems because I grew up with them, and I am a poet of memory.
author: Philip Levine

quote: As for political poetry, as it's usually defined, it seems there's very little good political poetry.
author: Kenneth Koch

quote: I love painting and music, of course. I don't know nearly as much about them as I know about poetry. I've certainly been influenced by fiction. I was overwhelmed by War and Peace when I read it, and I didn't read it until I was in my late 20s.
author: Kenneth Koch

quote: I was excited by what my painter friends were doing, and they seemed to be interested in our poetry too, and that was a wonderful little, fizzy sort of world.
author: Kenneth Koch

quote: I wonder if I ever thought of an ideal reader... I guess when I was in my 20s and in New York and maybe even in my early 30s, I would write for my wife Janice... mainly for my poet friends and my wife, who was very smart about poetry.
author: Kenneth Koch

quote: I was influenced by surrealist poetry and painting as were thousands of other people, and it seems to me to have become a part of the way I write, but it's not.
author: Kenneth Koch

quote: In high school I was very much involved in poetry. You cannot read a poem quickly. There's too much going on there. There are rhythms and alliterations. You have to read poetry slow, slow, slow to absorb it all.
author: Eugene H. Peterson

quote: It was actually a women's writing group I belonged to in graduate school that gave me the courage to move from poetry to fiction.
author: Mary Gordon

quote: Poetry is all nouns and verbs.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: I see no reason for calling my work poetry except that there is no other category in which to put it.
author: Marianne Moore

quote: One culture I find fascinating to juxtapose against American culture is the culture of Germany. They've gone through a long process through their art, poetry, public discourse, their politics, of owning the fact of their complicity in what happened in World War II. It's still a topic of everyday conversation in Germany.
author: Chris Jordan

quote: I've already written 300 space poems. But I look upon my ultimate form as being a poetic prose. When you read it, it appears to be prose, but within the prose you have embedded the techniques of poetry.
author: Story Musgrave

quote: If you read quickly to get through a poem to what it means, you have missed the body of the poem.
author: M. H. Abrams

quote: One can't write for all readers. A poet cannot write for people who don't like poetry.
author: Nathalie Sarraute

quote: Romance like a ghost escapes touching; it is always where you are not, not where you are. The interview or conversation was prose at the time, but it is poetry in the memory.
author: George William Curtis

quote: Fiction will always be my greatest love, with poetry close behind.
author: J. Courtney Sullivan

quote: People who read poetry, for example, like the feel, the heft and the smell of a book.
author: Simon Armitage

quote: I have always used a great variety of verse forms, especially in my poetry for children. I believe that poetry begins in childhood and that a poet who can remember his own childhood exactly can, and should, communicate to children.
author: William Jay Smith

quote: Nonfiction speaks to the head. Fiction speaks to the heart. Poetry speaks to the soul. It's the essence of beauty. The essence of pain. It pleases the eye and the ear.
author: Ellen Hopkins

quote: When I was in my late twenties, a friend suggested that, since I was an avid SF reader and had been since I was barely a teenager, that since it didn't look like the poetry was going where I wanted, I might try writing a science fiction story. I did, and the first story I ever wrote was 'The Great American Economy.'
author: L. E. Modesitt, Jr.

quote: Romanians have a particular love for poetry and have a beautiful, vivid language. The poets they love are not versifiers like Vadim Tudor, but genuinely complex mystical souls like Mircea Cartarescu.
author: Andrei Codrescu

quote: Each memorable verse of a true poet has two or three times the written content.
author: Alfred de Musset

quote: However, if a poem can be reduced to a prose sentence, there can't be much to it.
author: James Schuyler

quote: I am often asked why I started to write poetry. The answer is that my motivation sprang from a visceral need to creatively articulate the experiences of the black youth of my generation, coming of age in a racist society.
author: Linton Kwesi Johnson

quote: I've often said that all poetry is political. This is because real poems deal with a human response to reality and politics is part of reality, history in the making. Even if a poet writes about sitting in a glass house drinking tea, it reflects politics.
author: Yehuda Amichai

quote: I think that a good deal of poetry and art gives us some sense of access to another's voice, perception, texture of thought, imagination. Sometimes it gives us better access to the strangeness in ourselves.
author: Mary Szybist

quote: The job of the poet is to render the world - to see it and report it without loss, without perversion. No poet ever talks about feelings. Only sentimental people do.
author: Mark Van Doren

quote: How do poems grow? They grow out of your life.
author: Robert Penn Warren

quote: The poem is a little myth of man's capacity of making life meaningful. And in the end, the poem is not a thing we see-it is, rather, a light by which we may see-and what we see is life.
author: Robert Penn Warren

quote: You don't make a poem with ideas, but with words.
author: Stephane Mallarme

quote: A poem can have an impact, but you can't expect an audience to understand all the nuances.
author: Douglas Dunn

quote: Poetry, for me, is the answer to, 'How does one stay sane when private lives are being ransacked by public events?' It's something that hangs over your head all the time.
author: Lisel Mueller

quote: When I was in college, I did do some writing of poetry, somewhat inspired, I think at that time, by Carl Sandburg, because English was still relatively new to me, and Sandburg, of course, wrote in a very easy-to-understand, very colloquial and informal manner.
author: Lisel Mueller

quote: Memory and poetry go together, absolutely. It is a matter of preserving and of remembering things.
author: Lisel Mueller

quote: I was raised on songs of poetry like Simon and Garfunkel and Cat Stevens and Neil Young, etc. I love those old songs probably the most because they hit me so deep down in my core.
author: Jessica Steen

quote: Poetry is like making a joke. If you get one word wrong at the end of a joke, you've lost the whole thing.
author: W. S. Merwin

quote: Poetry is plucking at the heartstrings, and making music with them.
author: Dennis Gabor

quote: Poetry is necessary, but is the poet?
author: Carlos Drummond de Andrade
